p: A consecutive cross-sectional study was conducted in Puerto Maldonado in coordination with the “Dirección Regional de Salud Madre de Dios.” Puerto Maldonado is the capital of the Madre de Dios Region, a city in Southeastern Peru in the Amazon rainforest 55 km West of the Bolivian border. Puerto Maldonado has an estimated population of 74,949 and is recognized as an endemic area for dengue and other arboviruses [ 7]. Madre de Dios was chosen as the area of study as it is one of the most affected regions with DENV in Peru; it is located next to Brazil and Bolivia, where native cases Zika virus have been previously reported and it is also where the most significant outbreak of OROV was reported in 2016 [ 8, 9].
